solution_line_template: The first has an area of {area_first_rectangle} square inches because ({first_rectangle_width} x {first_rectangle_height}) = <<{first_rectangle_width}*{first_rectangle_height}={area_first_rectangle}>>{area_first_rectangle}.

The second has an area of {area_second_rectangle} square inches because ({second_rectangle_width} x {second_rectangle_height}) = <<({second_rectangle_width}*{second_rectangle_height})={area_second_rectangle}>>{area_second_rectangle}.
The difference in area is {area_first_rectangle}-{area_second_rectangle}=<<{area_first_rectangle}-{area_second_rectangle}={difference_in_area}>>{difference_in_area} square inches.
